briefdescription.para: Method table for a device backend.
Allocate and initialize the CPU backend implementation.

simplesect.para: Newly allocated cpu_impl_t pointer or NULL on OOM.

briefdescription.para: Report CPU device capabilities.

memberdef.argsstring: (void *self, const float *W, const float *x, float *y, size_t rows, size_t cols, const float *bias, size_t blk_k)
memberdef.name: cpu_gemv_f32

briefdescription.para: CPU implementation of GEMV FP32 via existing kernels.

parameterdescription.para: Number of rows in W (and y).
Number of columns in W (and x).

simplesect.para: 0 on success; non-zero on invalid parameters.

briefdescription.para: CPU implementation of memcpy wrapper.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; non-zero on invalid parameters.

briefdescription.para: Destroy CPU implementation object.
Attempt to construct a CUDA backend via dlopen (stub).

detaileddescription.para: Resolves libcuda only; kernels are not implemented yet. The device object will exist, but all compute methods return unimplemented until kernels land.

parameterdescription.para: Output: vtable populated with CUDA stubs.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; non-zero if CUDA cannot be initialized.

briefdescription.para: Report CUDA capabilities (stub: unimplemented compute).

memberdef.argsstring: (void *self, const float *W, const float *x, float *y, size_t rows, size_t cols, const float *bias, size_t blk_k)
memberdef.name: cuda_gemv_c

briefdescription.para: CUDA GEMV stub (returns unimplemented).
CUDA memcpy stub (returns unimplemented).
Destroy CUDA implementation and close libcuda handle.
Attempt to construct a Level Zero backend via dlopen (stub).

detaileddescription.para: Resolves ze_loader only; kernels are not implemented yet.

parameterdescription.para: Output: vtable populated with ZE stubs.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; non-zero if ZE cannot be initialized.

briefdescription.para: Report Level Zero capabilities (stub: unimplemented compute).

memberdef.argsstring: (void *self, const float *W, const float *x, float *y, size_t rows, size_t cols, const float *bias, size_t blk_k)
memberdef.name: ze_gemv_c

briefdescription.para: Level Zero GEMV stub (returns unimplemented).
Level Zero memcpy stub (returns unimplemented).
Destroy Level Zero implementation and close loader handle.
Try to open one of the candidate shared libraries using dlopen.

simplesect.para: dlopen handle on success; NULL if none can be opened.

briefdescription.para: Parse a device kind from a string (case-insensitive).

detaileddescription.para: Parse a device kind from a string.

briefdescription.para: Create a device for the requested kind, with CPU fallback.

detaileddescription.para: Create a device handle for the requested kind (with fallback).

parameterdescription.para: Output: allocated device handle on success.

briefdescription.para: Destroy a device handle and its backend implementation.

detaileddescription.para: Destroy a device handle and release resources.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve capabilities from a device backend.

memberdef.argsstring: (ie_device_t *dev, const float *W, const float *x, float *y, size_t rows, size_t cols, const float *bias, size_t blk_k)
memberdef.name: ie_device_gemv_f32

briefdescription.para: Execute GEMV on the device, with CPU fallback if unimplemented.

detaileddescription.para: Device-side GEMV (FP32): y = W * x (+ optional bias).

parameterdescription.para: Rows in W / length of y.
Cols in W / length of x.

briefdescription.para: Perform a memcpy using the device backend, with CPU fallback.

detaileddescription.para: Copy memory using the device backend.

briefdescription.para: C11 implementation of the device abstraction with CPU backend and CUDA/Level Zero stubs resolved via dlopen (graceful fallback).
